intro: Sideroxylon gossweileri, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a member of the Olacaceae family and is native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy surface, while the flowers are small and typically yellow or greenish-yellow. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought conditions.
